column4: can i set tty1 on my machine as another display for a machine connected through ssh ?
search for "tty rungetty auto login bashrc"
that's, if you want to start the ssh-terminal on startup
rumpel__:not on startup .. i just want to test when needed?
switch to tty1, log in, start ssh
hmm... you need gui? ... then start e.g. another x-server with "startx -- :1" ... hm..
i want to start X11 or whatever is needed to get a GUI for that machine
you can get GUIs with several methods... like Xforwarding for ssh
:1 is Xserver 1 ... when you have already running Xserver 0 (which is default)
on the new xserver you probably need to start "gnome-panel & disown" for gnome-panels
